value.name: Why cops who kill often catch a break at sentencing time
value.description: The average time they spend behind bars can be considerably less than that. Depending on the state, convicted felons can have as much as half their sentence lopped off if they behave themselves in prison.

value.name: Ronald Greene's death is one of many in which video and witness accounts reveal a clearer picture behind initial police accounts
value.description: When Ronald Greene's family first learned of his death, his mother said investigative officers with the Louisiana State Police told the family he crashed into a tree following a pursuit. But Mona Hardin says she was not told the whole story.

value.name: Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot’s New Plan For Civilian Oversight Of Police Keeps Her In Charge
value.description: After years of activist-led efforts for a civilian-focused oversight of the police department, the mayor offers her own vision, which maintains control over firing and hiring of top cop.

value.name: Lightfoot’s Plan For Police Oversight Released As Battle Brews Over Her Proposal And Aldermen-Backed ‘United Proposal’
value.description: Lightfoot's plan and the United Proposal differ in several ways — chief among them being that Lightfoot and future mayors would pick the police superintendent under her proposal.

value.name: Biden's eloquence with Floyd family will ring hollow if he gives Rahm Emanuel a key job
value.description: In Chicago, Emanuel helped cover up the police killing of a Black teenager. Does he deserve a key diplomatic post?

value.name: Pair of recent Chicago police killings puts spotlight on policies related to officer foot pursuits
value.description: In late March, 13-year-old Adam Toledo was fatally shot by Chicago police officers at the end of a foot chase. Police said body camera footage shows Toledo holding a gun in his right hand, but it vanishes from sight as he turns toward the officer and begins to raise his hands as he’s shot.
